rescuecore2.misc.gui
Class ShapeDebugFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      rescuecore2.misc.gui.ShapeDebugFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ShapeDebugFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

A JFrame that can be used to debug geometric shape operations. When enabled this frame will block whenever a show method is called until the user clicks on a button to continue. The "step" button will cause the show method to return and leave the frame visible and activated. The "continue" button will hide and deactivate() the frame so that further calls to show will return immediately.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Set the "background" shapes. These will be drawn on every invocation of show.

Show a set of ShapeInfo objects. If this frame is enabled then this method will block until the user clicks a button to continue.

Parameters:

shapes - A list of collections of ShapeInfo objects.

activate

public void activate()
Activate this frame. Future calls to show will block until the user clicks a button.

deactivate

public void deactivate()
Deactivate and hides this frame. Future calls to show will return immediately.
